availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John B. Vanhoose (Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of James Vanhoose and Elizabeth Vanhoose. Farmer in Johnson County in 1860. First lieutenant in the 39th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from February 16, 1863 to May 29, 1863.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, Paintsville, p. 71. Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0430. Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 408-09.
